Title: Associate Infrastructure Developer
Job_Description:
Job Classification:
Technology - Agile, Delivery, & Product
PGIM, the global investment management businesses of Prudential Financial Inc., is a multi-manager that delivers industry-leading strategies and solutions to clients. With offices located in 16 countries across five continents, PGIM is among the top 10 largest asset managers in the world with over $1 trillion in assets under management. Each business maintains its own investment process and culture, allowing for a singular focus on delivering investment returns for clients. The PGIM businesses offer investors a wide range of investment strategies across asset classes and geographies, including public equities, public and private fixed income, commercial mortgages and real estate.

The PGIM Finance Process and Technology team currently has an opening for a Finance Digital Transformation Specialist. Your role on this team will be to support the development & implementation of new, integrated financial modeling applications for PGIM, which will be utilized to meet business intelligence, data analytics, corporate planning, and stress testing needs. The candidate will partner with internal, and at times external technology solution providers, as well as PGIM Finance teams and business leaders, to deliver best in class business analytics solutions for PGIM and Prudential.

The successful candidate will be a proactive and versatile individual who thrives in fast-paced environments, is comfortable being in a role with high visibility and relishes the unique opportunity to play a pivotal role in an innovative financial modeling & technology transformation role in the enterprise. The individual will need to leverage knowledge of financial concepts (e.g.: P&L, BS, Capital/Debt) and technology (e.g.: Anaplan, PowerBI, Python, SQL, etc.) to partner and collaborate with finance, business and technology colleagues at all levels. This person is committed to personal growth, teamwork, eager to learn, and embraces complex challenges.


• Support the development and implementation of new PGIM financial modeling and business intelligence solutions, which includes but is not limited to:
• Develop modeling solutions to forecast and/or analyze various key business drivers and metrics, such as profitability by business, customer and product
• Partner closely with business finance teams to define business requirements through user stories and recommend process changes to support new modeling capabilities as needed
• Partner closely with the various technology stakeholders across the enterprise for data sourcing and sending data to data lakes and forecast ledger systems
• Work within an agile framework to complete projects working with other developers.
• Prototype, test, train, and implement business solutions under tight deadlines
• Provide status updates to and solicit key decision input from business partners and senior management
• Track and communicate deliverables and the associated timelines as well as project risks and dependencies
Specific responsibilities for the position will vary over time based on business needs and other factors.


• Required Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree in Business IT, Finance, or similar
• Deep analytical background (experience with modeling and/or analytics)
• Experience with data architecture
• 3-5 years of relevant work experience (finance, technology – preferably both)
• Strong interpersonal, communication, and problem-solving skills with an ability to influence effectively across various stakeholders
• Ability to drill into core issues with determination to come up with a solution
• Desire to learn new modeling and programming skills and openness to evolving needs across the business
• Strong organization, prioritization, and planning skills
• A team player who is ready to teach, to learn, and to influence
• Proficient in a coding language (SQL, Python)
• PowerBI or other data visualization/BI experience

Job_Description:
Job Classification:
Technology - Information Security
Security Strategy works with Global Technology to operationalize the overall security for the enterprise, in line with overall IT strategy. The individual would understand the strategy and manage large segments of information security projects through new designs and enhancements delivering them in collaboration within Information Security and business stakeholders. Team members are expected to use modeling to identify how solutions should evolve as threat landscapes change. Team members guide less experienced coworkers, receiving general guidance from leadership and frequently interacts with the Deputy CISO, members of IT Risk, Business Unit Developers, CTO Product teams, and other team members.

Prudential is looking for an individual to help design the future of security within the Information Security Office. Security strategy will influence enterprise wide direction on security policies and technologies. The ideal candidate will have a diverse background in networking and general knowledge of security technologies as well as concepts such as application, endpoint, and cloud technologies.

Responsibilities
• Develop and refine security standards, policies, procedures, and processes
• Evangelize new security technologies and techniques within the organization
• Identify security design gaps in existing technology and security tool landscape then recommend changes or enhancements
• Drive creative solutions to the tough to solve technical challenges with a focus on information and cyber security
• Communicate with high efficacy to stakeholders, peers, and the wider organization
• Actively participate in security team meetings that facilitate secure design
• Drive security efficiencies, enabling security team members to work on more advanced tasks
• Take ideas and concepts and visualize them in ways such that they are communicated effectively and compellingly for internal leaders, partners, and customers
• Evaluate and report technical architecture as per business requirements
• Estimate level of effort to implement designs to meet acceptance criteria
• Remain current with new security threats and assess systems to ensure they can defend the business
• Regularly monitor the security community for public-facing security issues as well as to learn new tactics for securing data transmissions and reducing attack exposure
• Leverage security standards and implementation configurations, as well as common security frameworks
• Document secure delivery and implementation advancements that meet defined service-level agreements (SLAs) and business metrics
• Perform other duties as assigned

Qualifications
• Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information security, or related discipline, or 4 years equivalent direct work-related experience in lieu of a degree
• A proven deep background preferred 5+ years in technology design, implementation, and delivery
• Extensive knowledge of traditional security controls and technologies, such as Intrusion Detection/Prevention Systems (IDS/IPS), Web Application Firewalls (WAF), Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) systems, etc.
• Knowledge and experience with a broad range of storage, infrastructure, virtualization, disaster recovery, datacenter systems, networking, security policies, databases etc.
• Solid understanding of TCP/IP and networking.
• Experience driving measurable improvement in monitoring and response capabilities at scale.
• Experience with one or more of the following security management frameworks: ISO 27001/27002, NIST, CIS Critical Security Controls (CSC), Cloud Security Alliance (CSA). A deep knowledge and understanding of relevant legal and regulatory standards / requirements
• Familiarity with state privacy laws
• Experience managing or strong working knowledge of Windows and Linux based environments.
• Ability to think strategically and tactically, with effective decision-making skills
• Demonstrate ability to influence, communicate, and lead
• Ability to build effective relationships with internal and external stakeholders
• Excellence in communicating business risk from cybersecurity issues
• CCNP, MCSE, AWS, Azure, CISSP, GIAC certifications, etc. are preferred
